title: Roguelike / Roguelite Project
description: A template for roguelike/roguelite games with procedural generation, permadeath, and run-based progression. Includes asset pipelines for items, enemies, rooms, and meta-progression systems.

decks.name: Items & Power-ups
decks.description: All discoverable items and their effects. Add an item card, then start its journey to create production tasks.

cards.content:
Fire Sword

A weapon that deals fire damage and can ignite enemies.

**Effect:** Bonus damage, chance to inflict burn damage over time
**Rarity:** Uncommon

This card has the **#uncommon** tag. Use rarity tags to control how often items appear in runs and to organize your loot tables.

> **Sub-Cards:** The tasks below were created by this card's journey. Each journey step creates a production task automatically - this is how Codecks helps you stay organized!

Health Potion

Instant heal consumable.

**Effect:** Restores health immediately
**Rarity:** Common
**Stack Size:** Up to 3

Common items like this should appear frequently to give players consistent options during runs.

Wings of Icarus

Grants temporary flight ability.

**Effect:** Can fly over pits and obstacles for 10 seconds
**Rarity:** Legendary
**Cooldown:** 60 seconds

> **Effort:** Estimated at 8 points because flight requires significant physics and level design considerations. Use higher effort estimates for complex features!

Iron Shield

Defensive equipment that blocks incoming damage.

**Effect:** Block next attack completely (breaks after 3 blocks)
**Rarity:** Common

This demonstrates defensive item design - should encourage aggressive play by providing safety net.

steps.content:
Create Item Icon & Description

Design the inventory icon and write the in-game description text.

Implement Item Effect Logic

Code what happens when the player uses/equips this item.

- [ ] Design implementation approach
- [ ] Write core logic
- [ ] Add edge case handling
- [ ] Write unit tests
- [ ] Code review

Create Item VFX

Add visual effects for using the item (particles, glows, etc.).

Design Item SFX

Create sound effects for pickup and use.

- [ ] Record or source base sounds
- [ ] Edit and layer audio
- [ ] Add variations
- [ ] Integrate in engine
- [ ] Test in game context

Balance Item Power Level

Playtest and adjust stats to ensure it's fun but not overpowered.

- [ ] Define success criteria
- [ ] Implement initial values
- [ ] Playtest
- [ ] Iterate based on feedback
- [ ] Document final values

decks.name: Enemies
decks.description: Enemy types that players encounter during runs. Add an enemy card, start its journey.

cards.content:
Goblin

Basic melee enemy that charges at the player.

**HP:** 20
**Damage:** 5
**Behavior:** Chases player when in range, attacks on contact
**Loot:** 50% chance to drop common item

**Appears in:** Early floors (1-3)

Necromancer

Ranged enemy that summons skeleton minions.

**HP:** 40
**Damage:** 8 (projectile)
**Behavior:** Keeps distance, summons skeletons every 10 seconds
**Loot:** 80% chance rare item

> **Priority:** This is marked priority 'b' since you should have basic enemies working before adding complex summoner mechanics.

Floor Boss

Powerful enemy guarding the exit to next floor.

**HP:** 200
**Damage:** 15-20
**Behavior:** Multi-phase fight with pattern changes
**Loot:** Guaranteed rare item

**Appears in:** Every 5th floor

decks.name: Room Types
decks.description: Procedurally placed room templates. Add a room card, start its journey to build it.

cards.content:
Combat Arena

A room focused on enemy encounters.

**Size:** Medium (15x15 tiles)
**Spawns:** 3-6 enemies based on floor depth
**Exits:** 2-3 doors
**Loot:** Always contains 1 chest

Combat rooms are the backbone of roguelike pacing - make sure they're varied and interesting!

Treasure Vault

A rare room with no enemies but high-value loot.

**Size:** Small (8x8 tiles)
**Spawns:** No enemies, but may have traps
**Loot:** 2-3 high-rarity chests
**Frequency:** 5% chance per floor

**Linked to:** Wings of Icarus (might need flight to access)

Shop Room

Merchant offering items for gold.

**Size:** Small (10x10 tiles)
**Spawns:** Friendly NPC merchant
**Stock:** 3-5 random items
**Frequency:** 15% chance per floor

Shops create interesting resource management decisions.

steps.content:
Design Room Layout

Sketch the room shape, door placements, and key features on grid paper.

Build Room Template

Create the room in your level editor with tiles and props.

Create Room Art Assets

Build unique props, decorations, or tile variations for this room type.

Add Room Ambiance

Create atmospheric sounds or music stingers for entering this room.

- [ ] Record or source base sounds
- [ ] Edit and layer audio
- [ ] Add variations
- [ ] Integrate in engine
- [ ] Test in game context

decks.name: Meta-Progression
decks.description: Permanent upgrades that persist between runs. These systems change how players approach future attempts.

cards.content:
Skill Tree System

Permanent unlockable abilities purchased with currency earned across runs.

**Currency:** Soul Gems (earned on death based on floor reached)
**Skills:** 20-30 nodes offering stat boosts and new abilities
**Reset:** Never (permanent upgrades)

This is the **#meta-progression** tag in action - content that stays with the player even after permadeath. This is what makes roguelites more accessible than pure roguelikes!

Starting Loadout Unlocks

New character classes or starting items unlocked through achievements.

**Examples:**
- Warrior: Unlocked by default
- Mage: Unlocked by reaching floor 5
- Assassin: Unlocked by completing a run without taking damage in 10 rooms

**Why this matters:** Gives players goals beyond just "reach the end" and adds replayability.

decks.name: Design Notes
decks.description: Design documentation, meeting notes, and playtesting findings. Use this deck to capture design decisions and their rationale.

cards.content:
Design Meeting: Meta-Progression Balance

**Date:** Week 5
**Attendees:** Full design team

**Decisions:**
- Permanent upgrades should provide 10-15% power boost max
- Focus on unlocking variety (new items/characters) over raw power
- First clear should be achievable without any meta-progression

**Rationale:** We want roguelite accessibility without removing roguelike challenge.

Playtesting Notes: Room Generation

**Session:** Week 6 playtest
**Issues:**
- Dead-end rooms felt punishing
- Too many empty rooms diluted pacing

**Changes:** Guaranteed reward in dead-ends, reduced empty room spawn rate.
